Reticular Action Model - Residuals \( \boldsymbol{ \hat{\Sigma} } - \boldsymbol{ \hat{\Sigma} } \left( \boldsymbol{ \hat{\theta} } \right) %(\#eq:sem-residuals) \)

Source: R/ram.R
ram_residuals.Rd

$$ \boldsymbol{ \hat{\Sigma} } - \boldsymbol{ \hat{\Sigma} } \left( \boldsymbol{ \hat{\theta} } \right) %(\#eq:sem-residuals) $$ where $$ \boldsymbol{ \hat{\Sigma} } \left( \hat{ \boldsymbol{\theta} } \right) = \mathbf{F} \left( \mathbf{I} - \mathbf{\hat{A}} \right)^{-1} \mathbf{\hat{S}} \left[ \left( \mathbf{I} - \mathbf{\hat{A}} \right)^{-1} \right]^{\prime} \mathbf{F}^{\prime} . %(\#eq:sem-ram-Sigmahatthetahat) $$ Items with a hat (^) are estimates using the sample data.

ram_residuals(Sigmahat, Sigmathetahat = NULL, Ahat, Shat, F, I)

Arguments

Sigmahat

Matrix. Estimated variance-covariance matrix \( \boldsymbol{ \hat{\Sigma} } \)
Sigmathetahat

Matrix. Model-implied variance-covariance matrix as a function of estimated parameters \( \boldsymbol{ \hat{\Sigma} } \left( \boldsymbol{ \hat{\theta} } \right) \) .
Ahat

\(mathbf{\hat{A}}\) matrix. Estimated asymmetric paths (single-headed arrows), such as regression coefficients and factor loadings
Shat

\(mathbf{\hat{S}}\) matrix. Estimated symmetric paths (double-headed arrows), representing variances and covariances.
F

\(\mathbf{F}\) matrix. Filter matrix used to select the observed variables.
I

\(\mathbf{I}\) matrix. Identity matrix.

See also

Other SEM notation functions: ram_M(), ram_Sigmatheta(), ram_S(), ram_mutheta()
